captions.text: What’s up you fucking punks
Desimpedidos is back with the World Cup group B squads
Pay attention to this shit because Brazil
is going to meet one of these teams in the next phase.
Spain
Spain is the country from the Iberian Peninsula
that colonized all of South America except for Brazil.
Therefore, Argentina's existance is their fault.
Compared to other European countries, Spain is second class
It’s in a crisis.
They have a king, but no one knows who he is.
They have bullfights, but no one likes it.
They have Rafael Nadal, that rhymes with… nothing in English.
The only major contribution of Spain to the world is the famous “espanhola” (titty fuck).
And Penélope Cruz as well.
Both things combined, aiaiai, so hot, estoy ficando caliente.
Spain’s squad is the decaying Barcelona,
without Messi and the goalkeeper Casilllas, who warms the bench at Real Madrid.
That annoying passing style of play went down under
when the "Furia" played against Brazil and got their asses kicked at the Confederations Cup finals
#thepaellahasgonebad
The highlights are:
The midfielder Xabi Alonso.
The defender Piqué who dates Shakira, but really likes Ibrahimovich’s nose.
The midfielder Iniesta who was born is Spain
but looks like he was born in the state of Ceara.
It’s actually over, but Maria just poked my crotch and asked to speak.
My highlight is Sergio Ramos, because he is magically hot
Wow, I’m salivating underneath just thinking about it.
Netherlands
The Nertherlands are a small flooded European country that is below sea level.
The flag is blue, white and red, but their jersey is orange
cause the dude who had this idea had dropped acid and smoked a huge chunk of skank at the coffee shop.
Instead of clothes and accessories, the store windows have prostitutes, and every strain of pot.
That’s why the Dutch squad is coming nice and easy to the World Cup.
So stop rolling those joints and release the highlights of the Clockwork Orange, Bolivian editor.
The actor Menfis Dipei, from Everybody Hates Chris.
The midfielder Sneijder, that plays nothing anymore.
And the attacking duo, without batman, but with two robins: Robin Van Persie and Arjen Robin.
Chile
Chile is the south American country squeezed between the Andes and the pacific ocean
Chile is so thin and long that it looks like the English player Peter Crouch.
Chile’s mission is to ruin Spain and the Netherland’s World Cup,
because their only claim to glory was to host the ’62 world cup,
where Brazil won for the second time.
In Brazil, the most famous player is the midfielder Valdivia.
I was going to open a pack of stickers, and when I ripped it I heard a noise ouch ouch ouch.
It was Valdivia, who hurt himself coming out of the package and is now resting in the medical department
That’s why he looks like he has something shoved up his ass.
The Highlights from Chile is the attacking duo formed by Alexis Sanchez, Neymar’s substitute at Barcelona.
And Eduardo Vargas, who used to play very well until Grêmio hired him.
Come back Zamorano, come back Marcelo Salas, come back Pinochet.
Australia
Australia is the biggest country of Oceania, where there are crocodiles on the countryside and sharks at the beach.
The only cool thing that came from Australia is the rock band AC/DC.
Australia only got in the World Cup because of the continental quota system.
If it was up to their soccer, Australia would be playing in the minor league, along with Fluminense.
Until recently, Australians thought they were playing rugby with an oval ball, and they would kick it away to reach the giant H.
Nowadays, they know they’re playing soccer,
but to them the ball remains oval and the players still kick it far away.
Just to give you an idea, the main highlight of the Australian squad is an animal that came from the Paralympic squad,
and it’s the only one who can score: the famous one-legged kangaroo.
He forms an attacking duo with the striker Cahill
who looks like the Mexican Chichiarito Hernandez after the photo app that makes people look like wrinkly old pedophiles.
That’s all folks,
next Thursday we’ll be back with Colombia, Greece, Ivory Coast and Japan.
SUBSCRIBE
